# The `filter_iterator_base` Class Template Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

An iterator adaptor that filters the elements of given inner iterators. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>template &lt;typename WrappedIteratorT, typename PredicateT, typename IterTag&gt;
class llvm::filter_iterator_base&lt;WrappedIteratorT, PredicateT, IterTag&gt;</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

An iterator adaptor that filters the elements of given inner iterators.

The predicate parameter should be a callable object that accepts the wrapped iterator&#39;s reference type and returns a bool. When incrementing or decrementing the iterator, it will call the predicate on each element and skip any where it returns false.


<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>&#91;&#93; = &#123; 1, 2, 3, 4 &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/riscvfencefield/#a147be9e9780c1e33363ea572d4c7b25fa1835091d83e0e052cd1a32c99b2be731">R</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a898e9304cf2baf908f4e9b8e32a5f6c3">make&#95;filter&#95;range</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#a2e38c85003a042421cde1647632d0b72">A</a>, &#91;&#93;(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>) &#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a> % 2 == 1; &#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// R contains &#123; 1, 3 &#125;.</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

Note: <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/filter-iterator-base">filter&#95;iterator&#95;base</a> implements support for forward iteration. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/filter-iterator-impl">filter&#95;iterator&#95;impl</a> exists to provide support for bidirectional iteration, conditional on whether the wrapped iterator supports it.
